Message.Title: NTWK $4.8..REPORTED RECORD 4Q and FY 2012.....GUIDED FOR $1/SHARE NET AND 40%+ REVENUE GROWTH IN 2013………… PRICE TARGET WAS RAISED TO $16 FROM $11/SHARE………… NTWK IS THE No1 GLOBAL CLOUD/LICENSE SOFTWARE PROVIDER FOR LEASING AND FINANCING APPLICATIONS...............3M SHARE FLOAT.......STRONG BALANCE SHEET…….. PLAN TO DOUBLE REVENUES AND NET INCOME TO $2/SHARE BY 2015……..5 FORWARD PE & 0.8 TIMES SALES – HUGELY UNDERVALUED FOR EXPONENTIAL PROFITABLE GROWTH
Message.Msg: SHORT TERM TARGET: $10+.......:) TECHNICALS IMPROVING SIGNIFICANTLY......AFTER EARNINGS PROFIT TAKING IS OVER AND THIS ONE IS POISED TO POP WITH A TINY 3M SHARE FLOAT ===== 9/4/2012 NTWK REPORTED RECORD 4Q AND FULL YEAR RESULTS - Fourth Quarter 2012 Revenue Surges to an all-time quarterly record of $14.3 Million on Increased License Revenues and associated maintenance and service agreements going forward - Fourth Quarter 2012 Earnings Advance Significantly to $0.25 per Diluted Share - Full Year 2012 revenues a record $38M - Full Year 2012 Earnings of $0.39/share - Company Expects Record Fiscal 2013 Annual Revenue Growing over 30% to $46 million to $49 million, With Earnings per Diluted Share Advancing to $0.80 to $1.00 - Per the CC, Company anticipates doubling revenues and net income by 2015 ==== NTWK HIGHLIGHTS: - Fast growing profitable US-based global cloud and license-based software company with 8 offices worldwide (US, China, Australia, UK, Pakistan, Singapore, Thailand, Saudi Arabia) – - Trading at 5 PE and 1 times sales – This is about 25% of sector average - Revenues are increasing at double digit rates, - Guidance calls for 30% revenue growth in 2013 - 3 consecutive quarters of profitability, - Guidance calls for $1/share net income in 2013!!! - Global alliances with Mercedes Benz and SANY Corp of China. - No. 1 in China and the APAC region in its niche market of leasing and financing software - It’s Vroozi Division is a fast growing Cloud Computing Play with strong relations with SAP, ORCL, MSFT. - Vroozi’s SAP-approved smartOCI procurement search catalog software built on SaaS is being adopted rapidly. Revenues exploded in 4Q 2012 and are expected to multiply in 2013 and a big reason for the 30%+ 2013 projected revenue increase - Vroozi has been created as independent entity to potentially IPO it or sell it to a cloud-acquiring giant like SAP and others - Strong balance sheet with $1/share Cash - With every license they sell a lucrative 5-year service and maintenance agreement building strong recurrent revenues - Huge and consistent insider buying. Insiders bought over 5% of the outstanding shares since 2010 - Strong institutional investor support grew to almost 20% from 11% last year - NTWK has over 50 Fortune 100 loyal customers. Never lost a customer. None of the customers is over 5% of the total revenues - partial customer list: CitiGroup, Mercedes Benz, Santander, BMW, Volvo, Ford, GE Capital, Cisco Capital, Paribas, GMAC, Toyota, Nissan, Hyundai, BYD, SANY Corp. China, etc.

Message.Title: Update on feedback and action taken by message board team
Message.Msg: Dear Finance Message Board Users, Thank you for providing constructive feedback over past few months. They are all great feedback and we truly appreciate it. I believe you will see more improvement in a few weeks. Here is list of key improvements we made based on your feedback. Ability for horizontal pagination in topic view. Ignore user Back to Board will take page to page from you came back. Go to Message board from any view Go to Topic from Message list view Readability issue Few bugs We plan to rollout below very quickly In thread view, ability to go to next and previous post. Few other minor enhancement like timestamp, spell check etc We are considering below in near future Ability to allow links in posts Limit alias to handful number We appreciate your valuable feedback, we are committed to improve experience of message board. Thanks, Message Board Team

Topic.Title: Update on feedback and action taken by message board team

Message.Msg: So things that already existed are going to be "added" as improvements? Huh? Where you're going sound like where InvestorVillage is now...

Message.Title: Why a quarterly dividend would send this stock soaring.
Message.Msg: Given that meyer doesnt want to part with yhoo money a small quarterly dividend would buy her time and send the stock soaring. suppose she decides to institute a .25 dividend per quarter.shw would only part with 2.4 billion of alibaba cash over next 2 years. the stock now yielding 6.8 % would be gobbled up. where else can you get that type of return on a growing(although small) company. Even at $20 it would still bring in 5%. Dividend buying funds and anyone with logic would buy this stock. This is much better than a one time dividend where afterwords an exodus from the stockwould happen. It would also buy at least 2 years time before a decision on other cash (dividend) can be dealt with.

Topic.Title: Update on feedback and action taken by message board team

Message.Msg: The serial message board spammers who steal from paying advertisers and Yahoo users with teaser headlines and multiple URLs to sell phony stock market letters and advice rely on links to run their scams. Without links, they are 90% out of business. Until Yahoo can find a away to block these spammers, allowing links only keeps these thieves in business.

Message.Title: Yahoo worth $36B, not $18B as current price...
Message.Msg: 40% Alibaba will bring Yahoo $15B cash... Yahoo Japan will bring Yahoo $6B cash... Yahoo itself has $3B cash... Selling Patent will bring Yahoo $2B cash(some estimated at $5B)... Selling Yahoo core business will bring $10B($1.36B positive cash flow per year, maybe $15B) Total $36B(or $44B, MSFT offered $47B a few years ago)... Yahoo is now selling at only $18B... At least 50% discount, absolutely under valued!!! We should see $20 in three months.

Topic.Title: Update on feedback and action taken by message board team

Message.Msg: I do post other stuff, but not often because I don't make political comments or statements about which way a stock is going and that pretty well eliminates most of the comments on these boards. I think serial spamming, while not only destructive in itself, is also a symptom of employees, managers, directors and an outside CPA (PricewaterhouseCoopers) many of whom have very little idea of what integrity should look like in a company. Do you remember Mayor Guiliani's comment about turnstyle jumpers? Their attitude should be - if you steal from us, our paying advertisers or our users, we will shut you down. Period. Not eventually. Not when we get our software working. But now. But when you have a CPA that doesn't post an email address or a hot line and a board secy's office that doesn't forward messages to directors and a customer care department that frequently doesn't seem to, this is what you get. There is probably a better way to stop these spammers, but eliminating links is probably the easiest and lowest tech.

Message.Title: Yahoo to keep Right Media, passes on potential $1B payout
Message.Msg: Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is placing a big bet on an ad technology that Yahoo previously planned to sell. Yahoo will not sell its advertising exchange Right Media, Yahoo Chief Revenue Officer Michael Barrett told Ad Age, according to an article posted Thursday. He said: “We just want to go on the record... Yahoo is committed to being a primary player in the ad technology space and Right Media is part of that strategy.”

Topic.Title: Update on feedback and action taken by message board team

Message.Msg: Rudy said that arresting a turnstyle jumper (a $.1.00 crime at that point?) was arresting a mugger on his way to work. Zero tolerance for small crimes works all the way up the chain. The serial spammers are still active. Still posting their scams but with copy-paste URL's which most people won't bother with. Also bumping their posts with the unlimited ID"s they get from Yahoo. So they haven't gone away. Yahoo hasn't gotten rid of them or their web sites. As a shareholder, I don't feel that these spammers belong on Yahoo. Anywhere. Can you imagine them on Microsoft; or Amazon; or Google; or any other legitimate company. Can you imagine any industry or business allowing some trying to rob their customers to set up shop in their physical or web space? It is amazing that the Yahoo "suits" don't even notice or don't care that someone is running a 3 card monte scheme on their property! I agree that a high tech company would find a better way. But Yahoo is not really a high tech company any more; it is an average-tech company that is slowly declining. Picture a store prone to shoplifters. Instead of keeping them out at the entrance, the company has put in a very small exit door so that they can't take out any merchandise. Of course, that hurts all customers but if that is the best they can do....

Topic.Title: Yahoo Jumps from $14.60 to $15.20 in 4 Days

Message.Msg: It also took only 4 days for Yahoo to drop from the 16s to the 14s for no special reason -nobody with insider knowledge illegally selling, no secret news was on the way, no deals or plots about to be published. That’s just how this stock behaves. Up and down up and down up and down. Learn to live with it, prepare for it and profit from it. If you are not married to this stock you are in this to make money. Make money when the stock moves up, it always does, and when the stock moves down, it always does.
